content: the back this chain 1 will be the middle of the back of your sweater if you started with an fsc you can skip this part if you started with chs put a single_crochet in each chain making sure you move your stitch marker to your new corresponding stitch sl to first single_crochet chain 2 turn this row will start your increases double_crochet in each stitch up to marker in marked stitch double_crochet ch1 double_crochet you can remove your marker or place it on the ch1 to make it easier to find repeat this same pattern to end of round double_crochet with a double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in each marked stitch sl to first double_crochet you should now be able to see the pentagon shape if you lay your yoke flat try it on again to make sure your collar fits like you want it to ch1 turn single_crochet in each stitch until you reach the ch1 in this ch1 space put single_crochet ch1 single_crochet repeat this same pattern with a single_crochet in each stitch until the ch1 where you will put a single_crochet ch1 single_crochet sl to first single_crochet if you like to count stitches each round should increase by 10 stitches to verify that you have not dropped a stitch you can check that you have the same number of stitches between each ch1 space for the shoulder parts and that the front part has either 1 or 3 additional stitches compared to the back part ch2 turn repeat the previous steps with alternating row of single_crochet and double_crochet with the stitch ch1 stitch grouping in every ch1 space from the previous row keep making row until the ch1 corners for each shoulder sit right below your armpit making sure you end on a double_crochet row step two create the body of your sweater note you may want to work to the end of your first cake and then start on your sleeves before finishing the body if you only have 3 cakes this will ensure that you have enough of the colors you will need to make sleeves that fit with the color pattern of the body if you are making a plus size sweater this might result in the starting color for your sleeves being absent from the bottom of the sweater s body you can always buy an extra cake if you want to ensure this does not happen if you are not using a self-striping yarn this will not be a problem provided you purchased enough yarn for each color in your selected scheme this section works as a continuation of the yoke you just created but adds a chain between the corners at each shoulder to travel under the arm and create the armholes start your next single_crochet row like all previous single_crochet row with a ch1 and turn single_crochet until you reach the ch1 space single_crochet in the ch1 space now you will need to create a row of fsc to connect to
